Description: Vessel with rounded base of rough brown ware pottery originally with a single loop handle over the top, made of Nile silt fabric with large organic voids and white mineral grit. Surface is worn; originally self-slipped reddish with many fire cloud stains, burnished vertically. Rim is pinched irregularly, rising up around the points of attachment for the handle, scars of which remain. Marks from manufacture are visible on interior walls as finger impressions made during the attachment of the coiled walls to the mould-made base.
Curator's comments: Brunton’s (1937) Miscellaneous class MS35. Vases with loop handles are extremely rare in the Badarain corpus and contineud to be rare in the Predynastic period.
Bibliographic references: Brunton 1937 / Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture (p. 49; pl.18,35)
Condition: fair (incomplete -handle missing, surface worn at base)
